frequent_io Package¶

data_import Module¶

Functionality to handle the importing and exporting of data

Broadly contains the functionality to a) Download csv data b) Import csv data to a databse c) Query a database for specific information d) Import csv files with improved headers and mapping e) Create a database from scratch

nzem.frequent_io.data_import.create_il_dataset(folder_name='il_data', quick_parse=True, date_time_index=False, title_columns=True, date_period=True, date='TRADING_DATE', period='TRADING_PERIOD', date_time='Date Time', map_dataframe=True)[source]¶

Load the full IL data set as a raw group of data

nzem.frequent_io.data_import.execute_query(SQL, dbname='Electricity_Database', password='Hammertime', user='local_host', something=None)[source]¶

Will connect to a database, execute a query and return a DataFrame containing the queried information

Parameters :SQL : The SQL query to be executed
Returns :df : A Pandas DataFrame containing the queried data
nzem.frequent_io.data_import.load_csvfile(csv_name, quick_parse=True, date_time_index=True, title_columns=True, date_period=False, trading_period_id=False, date='Trading Date', period='Trading Period', tpid='Trading Period Id', date_time='Date Time', niwa_date=False)[source]¶

Master function to handle the importation of data files for analysis. Has capabilities of handling a broadish range of dates which is pretty sweet. All the is needed to run the file is a file and information about what the date column names are

Parameters :

csv_name : The name of the CSV file to be loaded

quick_parse : Whether to apply a memoised version of the date time parsing

date_time_index : Apply the date time column as the new index

title_columns : Change column names to a “title” format

date_period : Whether to apply the date_period parse method

trading_period_id : Whether to first convert a TPID to date_period syntax

date : The column name of the Trading Date

period : Column name of the Trading Period

tpid : Column name of the Trading Period ID

date_time : Column name of the datetime index

niwa_date : Whether the horrible NIWA date format is used (hydrology data..)
Returns :

df : A sorted dataframe with the date time index loaded and working
nzem.frequent_io.data_import.load_map(map_fname=None)[source]¶

Load a mapping DataFrame, will default to the Nodal Information Dataframe contained in the maps directory

Parameters :map_fname : Filename containing the path to the directory
Returns :df : A pandas dataframe containing the mapping information
nzem.frequent_io.data_import.map_data(df, node_map=None, left_on='Grid Exit Point', right_on='Node', map_reference='Island Name')[source]¶

Will map a DataFrame using the given Nodal Map and return the merged DataFrame

Parameters :df : The DataFrame to be matched
Returns :merged_df : The df merged with the mapping dataframe
nzem.frequent_io.data_import.map_date_period(series, date_map=None, date='Trading Date', period='Trading Period')[source]¶

Will map a trading date and a trading period together in order to form a single consistent date time parameter

Parameters :

series : A single series containing information about the row

date_map : A dictionary containing mapping information regarding the

dates, is used to preparse a single copy of each date as the parse function tends to be very CPU intensive

date : The date column name

period : The period column name
Returns :

Date Time : A single value of DataTime format containing the trading period

and trading date data as a combined date and time.
nzem.frequent_io.data_import.query_database(table, start_date=None, end_date=None, companies=None)[source]¶

Constructs an SQL query to query a particular table within the Database If no dates are specified will default to the current day

master_set Module¶

Generic “Load All” function to make creating a merged dataset simpler when beginning a new analysis

nzem.frequent_io.master_set.columnise_energy_prices(df, island_split=True)[source]¶

Columnise the energy price dataframe

nzem.frequent_io.master_set.columnise_res_prices(df, island_price=True, islandid='Island Id', longname=False)[source]¶

Columnise the reserve price dataframe

nzem.frequent_io.master_set.load_masterset()[source]¶

Load a master dataset will return a merged DataFrame containing the following information time alligned:

  1. Energy Prices (Five Nodes)
  2. Reserve Prices (Two Region, Two Type)
  3. Hydro Lake Storage
  4. Hydro Inflow Levels
  5. National Demand
